Sentencas: Developing novel solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) with high stability running at low tem-peratures is an important objective in SOFC science.
Titulo: Modeling and microstructural study of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells: Experimental and thermodynamic analyses

Sentencas: In the current paper, a comprehensive physics-based microstructure modeling using scanning electron microscope (SEM) image analysis was performed on several anode-support SOFCs operating at low temperatures with high stability.
Titulo: Modeling and microstructural study of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells: Experimental and thermodynamic analyses

Sentencas: To bridge the gap in the literature regarding an accurate and realistic modeling, a new model was developed based on the variable fuel and air utilization factors and updated microstructure values (e.g., tortuosity, porosity, pore size, grain size).
Titulo: Modeling and microstructural study of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells: Experimental and thermodynamic analyses

Sentencas: The model accuracy was verified by a thorough point-to-point validation for eight different cells with the configuration of Ni-YSZ (anode), YSZ (electrolyte), and GDC/PNO (cathode).
Titulo: Modeling and microstructural study of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells: Experimental and thermodynamic analyses

Sentencas: Different temperatures, hydrogen, and air mass flow rates were used, for which an average error of less than 3% in the I-V curves was achieved.
Titulo: Modeling and microstructural study of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells: Experimental and thermodynamic analyses

Sentencas: The microstructure of the cells, including cathode thickness (15-26 mu m), anode-support thickness (350-460 mu m), porosity (39 and 43%), grain size (1.1-1.4 mu m), and pore radius (0.9-1.1 mu m) were varied.
Titulo: Modeling and microstructural study of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells: Experimental and thermodynamic analyses

Sentencas: Moreover, the effects of the critical operational and design parameters on the overpotential losses and cell performance were studied.
Titulo: Modeling and microstructural study of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells: Experimental and thermodynamic analyses

Sentencas: The results show that a hydrogen flow rate of 43 sccm was ideal when the cell operated at 0.9 A/cm2 and 700 degrees C. Moreover, an average anode -support pore radius of 1.75 mu m resulted in the best cell performance.
Titulo: Modeling and microstructural study of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells: Experimental and thermodynamic analyses

Sentencas: It was also concluded that the electrolyte thickness has a higher effect on the cell performance compared to the cathode thickness.
Titulo: Modeling and microstructural study of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells: Experimental and thermodynamic analyses
